title: India's Position in Global Fish Production
content: India is the second-largest fish producer in the world, contributing over 7.5% to global fish production.

title: The Role of the National Fisheries Development Board (NFDB)
content: The National Fisheries Development Board (NFDB) in India acts as a centralized hub for fisheries data, promoting sustainable fishing practices!

title: Community-Based Fishing in India States
content: In Kerala, community-based fishing practices like those in Chilika Lake ensure sustainable harvesting through shared fishing rights among local families.

title: India's Contribution to Global Shrimp Export
content: India is the largest exporter of shrimp globally, accounting for over 25% of the world's total shrimp exports.

title: Marine and Inland Fisheries Production
content: Indiaâ€™s fish production comes equally from marine and inland sectors, with both contributing nearly 50% each to the national output.

title: Fisheries and Rural Employment in India
content: Around 14 million people in India are directly involved in fishing, providing livelihood to a large portion of the rural population.

title: Fisheries in India's Northeast Region
content: The Northeast region of India, particularly Assam, is known for its diverse freshwater fish species, which form a significant part of local diets.

title: Impact of Fish Farming in India
content: Fish farming, especially in states like Andhra Pradesh, has significantly boosted India's fish production, making it a key player in the aquaculture sector.

title: Technological Advancements in India's Fisheries
content: India is investing in technology such as satellite monitoring and data analytics to improve the sustainability and efficiency of its fisheries industry.

title: Fish Exports to Neighboring Countries
content: India exports fish and seafood to several neighboring countries, with significant trade in Bangladesh, the Maldives, and Sri Lanka.
